result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary Jo C McMullen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 315 Days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for Panera Bread ($40.00); Citi Bank ($421.40) and Roundy's ($350.00) to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision. Restitution to be paid before fines or fees. Restitution payable out of 20% of prison wages while incarcerated.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with Any Panera Bread, the Pick N Save on Calhoun Road or with Alice C. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling or any other condition deemed appropriate by agent.  Cases 14CF922, 14CM378 and 14CM1403 were dismissed and read in. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Certified copy of the 8/9/17 Order
 It is ordered that the judgment of conviction is modified to reflect a DNA surcharge of $250;as modified, the judgment is summarily affirmed pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21 and the cause is remanded for entry of a corrected judgment of conviction.  It is further ordered that once an amended judgment of conviction is entered, Attorney Patricia A. FitzGerald is relieved of further representing McMullen in this matter. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(2).  It is further ordered that this summary dispostion order will not be published.

Defendant Mary Jo C McMullen in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  The State requests the Court order that a Presentence Investigation Report be prepared and filed with the Court.  The Court orders a presentence investigation report be ordered and filed with the Court within 30 days.  The Court revokes bail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-01-2016 02:30 pm
Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4 (filed in 14CM378)

Defendant Mary Jo C McMullen in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to address the issue of the Defendant's competency.  The Defendant is mute on her response regarding competency. The State calls Dr. Rawski and he is sworn and testifies.  State moves for admission of Exhibit #3.  The Court accepts Exhibit #3 into evidence.   Dr. Rawski has determined that the Defendant is competent to stand trial. Cross examination by Attorney Martinez. Redirect by the State. The witness is excused.  The State rests.  The Defense calls Dr. Verwert and he is sworn and testifies.  Dr. Verwert has determined the Defendant is not competent to stand trial. Cross examination by the State.  Redirect by Attorney Martinez. The defense rests.    Closing statement made by the State.  Closing statement made by Attorney Martinez.  The Court finds the Defendant is competent to stand trial based on the testimony presented in Court. Attorney Bayer advises the Court that there is a possible new referral in their office.  Attorney Martinez requests the matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mary Jo C McMullen in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Martinez is requesting adjournment of trial, because defendant has not received her medications while in custody, therefore, Attorney Martinez requests a competency evaulation be done within 15 days under 971.14(2) on in in-patient basis. Court orders Wisconsin Forensic Unit to do an inpatient evaluation under 971.14(2), Wisconsin Statutes to be done within 15 days.
Court remands defendant to the Sheriff to be transferred to a State Mental Health Institution for the examination. 
Court cancels trial.  Review hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
